message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public static byte[] stringToByte(String text) {
    StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(text, " ");
    byte[] raw = new byte[st.countTokens()];
    int i = 0;
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        String token = st.nextToken();
        raw[i] = (byte) Integer.parseInt(token, 16);
        i++;
    }
    return raw;
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the given code, the StringTokenizer is used to split the input string by space (" ") delimiter. Then, each token is converted to a byte by parsing it as an integer with base 16 (hexadecimal). The resulting byte is stored in the raw array. Finally, the raw array is returned. This code will correctly convert the input string "55 55 F5 FF FF" to the byte array {(byte) 0x55, (byte) 0x55, (byte) 0xF5, (byte) 0xFF, (byte) 0xFF}.
